column4: im trying to switch from windows to ubuntu, but im having a hard time finding all the drivers i need. is there any 'central' place where i could look that up? googling every device i have takes foreever
right now im mostly concerned about my graphics card, SiS M760GX, and my wireless usb, Netgear WG111
i read about ndiswrapper for my wireless device, but cant find any real answer for the graphics card
do you have the windows drivers for your wireless card?
install ndiswrapper and follow the steps of the tutorial
no..i work with ndiswrapper and it works great
if you don't try it won't work ;)
you said you have the windows drivers?
true. but i also need a long time to format, install two operating systems, etc etc. so if i know something wont work at all, i'd rather wait till i get a new computer
so you don't have ubuntu now?
here the live cd also works but also no internet because the live cd doesnt include ndiswrapper
older systems are better supported, but you want a new computer.. but you can google on "linux YourNewComputer"
are you going to buy a laptop?
im trying to. but its pretty complicated
i wanna get it from US. much cheaper
where do you live? if you want to buy a laptop: check http://www.linux-laptop.net/
